captions.text:
You could drive the Charger fast. Let's do
that.

The Dodge Charger Hellcat sounds like the stuff of fantasy. A large family sedan
packing 707 horsepower, brembo brakes, adaptive

shocks, and a claimed top speed of over 200
miles per hour. And all for around $64,000.

You can think of it as fundamentally the same
car as the Challenger Hellcat and this has

4 doors which somehow gives it a functionality
that makes it even cooler. And it makes us

ask: for the money is it the ultimate family
sedan? SO it shouldn't be surprising the Charger

Hellcat is just as good at performance as
the other Hellcat. They have the same power

figures, they weigh about the same. But what
I'm trying to think about though is which

is crazier? Because the thing about muscle
cars with 700 horsepower from the factory

that is crazy and you want to postion one
above the other in terms of the crazier one.

You might think its the Challenger because
its the 2 door one that looks great doing

drifts and stuff but I think the 4 door is
the crazier car. Having 4 doors and looking

as stealth as this car kind of does gives
this car a veil of civility which is a total

lie. Because it's stiff it's not stiff at
all in fact it's easy to drive. Because of

the power potential you have 700 HP in a family
sedan. You have that sound you thave this

kind of acceleration at your disposal. Also
you can drive your family to the grocery store.

That's absurd this is a bizarre time to be
into cars because we have things like this

in existence. What this is essentially is
an American M5 would that be fair to say?

Sort of stealth looks with ridiculous power
on tap it does so without being in your face

and that to me is crazier. What's even more
peculiar is as much fun as exercising this

horsepower is I actually don't mind going
around town going slowly driving Ms Daisy.

There's something about having the awesome
performance available but not using it and

deciding that. It must be how Clark Kent feels
all the time. The Charger is longer and taller

than the Challenger and heavier by 113 pounds.
But as we find on the test track none of that

really matters. On our unprepped surface the
Charger lacked launching in second gear with

its throttle application. Reaching 60 miles
an hour in 3.7 seconds it ties the Challenger.

Passing the quarter at 11.8 seconds at 124.3
miles per hour it's a 1/10th of a second and

1 mile per hour slower. It's best stop from
60 took just 104 feet. At 24.5 seconds around

the figure 8 the Charger again is virtually
the same as the Challenger. And it makes the

same amount of tire smoke in the process.
The Challenger proved it's straight line performance

when it did the standing mile in 30.1 seconds
at 193.8 miles an hour. That's just 3/10th

of a second slower than the ZR1 by the way.
Considering how close the Charger's performance

is to the Challenger we have not reason to
doubt it's just as fast. So we're going to

do a hotlap with Randy Pobst. The Charger
is by no means a road racing car so we decided

to see what he would place at Streets of Willow.
It's hard to decide what's cooler about the

Charger Hellcat: the speed it's capable of
or how docile it can be in spite of it's power.

Here we have a sedan that's a set of rear
radials away from being a 10 in the drag strip.

Dodge says it can do over 200 and it's easy
to believe that claim. You just ned to find

a road that's closed and long enough. But
the real kicker is this 707 horsepower hot

rod of a family car has no special treatment.
It starts up just find on cold morning it

idles smoothly it's well behaved in traffic
its to the point your mom could drive it and

have no idea what it's capable of. It's this
combination that makes this Charger Hellcat

so unique and so wonderful. It's all really
nice the seats are comfortable and they're

well bolstered. This would be a good one to
have in the garage to do all the normal daily

stuff and have a lot of fun with and then
have a lot of projects on the side. This is

a daily driver for the crazier folk that have
crazier project cars. You know what would

make this better? A wagon. Magnum Hellcat.
That would make this the best car on earth.

Nope 240 SS would be the best this would be
the second best car on earth.

title: 2015 Dodge Charger SRT Hellcat: The Most Powerful Sedan In The World! - Ignition Ep. 122
